intro: Eritrichium affine, commonly known as the slender blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and meadows. It has hairy, slender stems and produces small, oval-shaped leaves. Eritrichium affine is often found in the western United States and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance.
